meanings.definition: A person who revises or makes changes to something, especially written material.
meanings.sent1: The revisers carefully checked the essay for any mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The team of revisers worked together to improve the report.
meanings.sent3: The revisers found a funny typo in the story and fixed it.
meanings.sent4: She was like a reviser of her own life, constantly editing and rewriting her experiences.
meanings.sent5: The revisers were like detectives, searching for errors in the text.

meanings.definition: A group of people who review and make corrections to a document or text.
meanings.sent1: Our revisers meet every Friday to discuss the changes needed in the manual.
meanings.sent2: The revisers gathered around the table to go through the manuscript.
meanings.sent3: The revisers joked about the misspelled words they found in the contract.
meanings.sent4: The revisers were like a well-oiled machine, fixing errors with precision.
meanings.sent5: The revisers were the unsung heroes of the publishing process, ensuring perfection in every text.
